DialogueLine.dialogue: Hello...
Is there something you need?
Do you need anything, Ma'am?
No. Is there a problem?
No. Do you need help with something?
I haven't seen the director anywhere, no.
Do... do you think I'm suspicious? I haven't done anything!
Of course. I'll let you know.
Yes... Good luck ma'am.
Well, that's odd. I have tried contacting him too, and he isn't answering me, either. And he hasn't called since yesterday.
So he didn't answer? I see... He hasn't contacted me at all either. Usually he approaches me with some things I have to do... Yesterday was the last time we talked.
I don't know where he is, unfortunately. If he's not answering his phone, then that's definitely strange, because he didn't answer any of my calls today either.
I'm not sure where he is. He doesn't answer my calls either. He last approached me yesterday.
I know. I'm a bit worried about him, in fact...
Yes. It's a bit worrying... but I don't know what to do.
I've been worried about the museum ever since you told me about the plinth going missing... I'm not sure what to do with the director gone!
A little... but Ma'am Cassandra must be struggling, as she's the one who wanted to put this whole exhibit together...
O-only a little. I'm more worried about what the director will say when he comes back...
Just a little bit... don't worry about me...
I was! I do reach out but he isn't answering.
Are you serious? I did reach out to him, but he doesn't answer my calls.
Y-you're right. I'm sorry....
I'm not sure there's much I can offer in the way of help... maybe we can ask the other staff if they have talked to the director recently?
I'm not sure if this will be much help... but maybe I can help you get into the director's office. I gave the custodian a copy of the keys in case of emergencies.
P-please calm down... I have a copy if the key but I gave it to one of the custodians downstairs.
I'm pretty sure it's in one of the lockers downstairs. The passcode is his daughter's birthday... I think I asked and it's around the first week of October? That's all I know.
I think I remember him approaching me and telling me about the locker downstairs... The passcode is his daughter's birthday, somewhere in the first week of October.
Please don't! I don't know what to do!
You won't at least help me?
I think the best help I can offer is to ask other staff. I'm sorry I can't do much else. Feel free to ask if you have more questions, though!
I think you can ask other staff... I'm sorry I'm not much help.
Hey, I already did! Have you checked the locker I told you about?
Please check the locker I was telling you about first... That's all I can offer right now...
You should probably check the locker I told you about, before asking for more help.
I'm sorry, there's nothing else I can do.
Uh... uh... I don't think it's that serious?
Hey--that won't work with me. I know this is important to you and Cass, but that's not enough for me to help.
I know, but we're not sure if this is as big of an emergency you've mentioned. Don't you think you're blowing this out of proportion?
This could be an emergency... but I could be in trouble.
Still! You don't understand, the director is quite strict with his privacy.
O-oh... But it's not my fault... I didn't lose it myself...
But I didn't lose it myself, so I don't know if he'll blame me for that.
W-well. You could be right.
Okay, fine. I gave an extra key to the custodians. They put it in their locker.
O-okay! Fine. I gave an extra key to the custodians. For... for emergencies. It's in their locker.
That's... good... I'm sorry I couldn't help.
I'm sorry I couldn't help further. I didn't want to get in trouble with the director.
Hmmm... Beth. I don't know her by name, but could she be the woman that the visits often?
Sorry, I don't really know who 'Beth' is, by name. But... there's only one woman aside from the director's wife that seems close to him: one of his frequent visitors.
I-I don't need to see it! Please don't get me into trouble. Anyway... I don't know who Beth is. Perhaps one of the custodians have an idea of the women in the director's life.
I don't want to snoop at all... I don't need to see the card to guess that Beth may be the woman who visits the director a lot. You'll have to ask the custodians for more information.
I won't be of much help if you don't have the key on-hand. Can I see it?
Hmmm... I'm not sure whose key that is. Maybe ask Cassandra or the custodians, they may have lost a key while meeting with director Virgil.
I don't know much... I don't interact with her a lot. She does approach me first to bring along some gifts. Sometimes I ask if it's for the director, but she tells them it's for me...
I've spoken to her sometimes, although our conversations aren't very interesting... She gives me and the staff some gifts and she seems a bit... privileged and well-off.
She looks pretty well-off. She has blonde hair, probably early thirties?
I don't really notice things like that... But she dresses very well. She's also quite tall...
Yes, I'm glad someone has the same thoughts as I do. What now?
I had the same idea! She could be the woman that brings gifts to all the staff, considering that she seems to have a good relationship with the director.
Yes, I heard them fight, just as you did.
That's good... If you need any help, I'll be right here.
Okay. Ask me anything if you need any help.
During your vacation, Cassandra and the director had some problems. The director, in particular, thought that the plinth was useless historically, so we don't need it for the exhibit...
He didn't plan to discard it. He was... he was planning to sell it to the founder of the museum.
I did.
I did, and it's because of what I told you before. The director thinks that the plinth was not important enough to be in the exhibit.
She knows he wants to sell the plinth to *someone*, but I don't think she knows he'll sell it to the founder of the museum.

The director plans on selling the plinth off, most likely to the founder of the museum. Artifacts can fetch a decent price, even if director Virgil thinks that it doesn't have much value to the exhibit.
I've heard rumors that the founder has an obsession with collecting artifacts. Plus, she funds this museum, so I can imagine that the director wants some rapport with her.
Yes. It's the most logical assumption.
Usually he asks for a short work day at the first week of October.
Goodbye.
Woah! The statue is more beautiful than I thought. Where did you find it?
The statue is so pretty... I wonder who brought this in, though.
What?! The artifact is gone?! We have to tell the director ASAP!
Welcome back, Enid. We missed you.
Oh no... They're fighting again...
I'm glad the fighting's over... How can I help you?
Is there anything else you need?
If there's any information you want to know, feel free to ask me.
I will ummm... I'll try to contact him. Let me know if you're able to, too.
I'll try calling him over and over. This should be an emergency.
What?! I'll call him for you. Please let me know if you can contact him too.
What?! I-I'll have to call him! You should have told me this as soon as you saw me...
Oh, yes. I lock the door behind me whenever the director's not around.
Oh... I don't really know, Ma'am. I haven't noticed anything out of the ordinary.
Oh, I can't. I don't want to get in trouble.
